revisionDesc.change: Pull translation out of APIS record.

listBibl.bibl: F.A.J. Hoogendijk - P. van Minnen, Papyri, Ostraca, Parchments and Waxed Tablets in the Leiden Papyrological Institute (P. L. Bat. 25) (Papyrologica Lugduno-Batava 25, Leiden 1991), p. 134-140 P.Leid.Inst. 27 is also cited as P. L. Bat. 25 27

div.ab:
P. L. Bat. 25 27 (English)
Recto (1st hand) - - - to Theon (?) Zopyrus greets the most honorable Theon. I have received the deed for the 1 ½ ¼ arouras for - - - and - - - being part part of the kleroi of Isizelmis and Zazelmis. Its neighbours: to the south, Claudia Heraclia and others; to the north and east, Iason, son of Ptolemaeus, and others; to the west, a mound. Tesenptollis from the village of Thmoinetei in the Cynopolite nome, and Sambion, son of Dositheus, whose mother is Demarion, from Psychis in the (district) Pasko in the Hermopolite nome. The scribe’s fee is yours, as you wish.
Verso [Notes by Theon] (2nd hand) An order from Thoonis, accountant of Tiberius Claudius - - -, by Rodocles the steward of Lacholos in the upper district of the Hermopolite nome.
A contract of Apoll. . ., son of Posidonius the Elder, grandson of Ptoll..., whose mother is Isidora, of (the village of) Ptemenkurkis (?), by - - -.
An order of Sarap. . . the elder, nicknamed Shorty (?), without father (?) - - -, for 8 drachmas. ------------------------------------------ Draw up a - - - document (?) for Sarap. . . son of Diogenes, grandson of Phaminus, elder of (the village of) Ares (?) in the district Patre (?) - - - district - - -.
